gml:Dictionary.gml:description: A set of interrelated components which define a geological time scales, values taken from the ICS - detail in Permian only In this version *all* the componnets required are included in a single (rather unwieldy) document, and most cross-references are local (i.e. to locations within the document). A more manageable normalised version is alongside this document in the repository. This document will not be maintined after 2005-05-16 so may not be valid according to the latest version of the schema.
gml:Dictionary.gml:name: ICS time scale - Permian detail

gml:TimeCoordinateSystem.gml:description: Time coordinate system for geological time - millions of years
gml:TimeCoordinateSystem.gml:name: Geological coordinate system - Ma

gml:TimeInstant.gml:description: Conventional origin used for carbon dating. Equivalent to "present" for other radiometric dating techniques which have much lower precision.

cgi:GeologicTimeScale.gml:description: The geologic timescale, as defined by ICS
cgi:GeologicTimeScale.gml:name: ICS Geologic Timescale

cgi:GeochronologicEra.gml:name: Paleozoic
Permian
cgi:GeochronologicEra.meta:comment: Permian-Carboniferous time scale is derived from calibrating a master composite section to selected radiometric ages
Paleozoic Era. Note that this era definition contains references to some eras that are not yet described here: viz. G, O, S, D, C.

cgi:GeochronologicEra.gml:name: Mesozoic
cgi:GeochronologicEra.meta:comment: Mesozoic Era Note that this era definition contains references to some eras that are not yet described here: viz. T, J K.

cgi:GeochronologicEra.gml:name: Cenozoic
cgi:GeochronologicEra.meta:comment: Cenozoic Era Note that this era definition contains references to some eras that are not yet described here: viz. Pg, Ng.

meta:QualitativeAssessment.meta:explanation: Vague estimation from bracketing radiometric ages

cgi:GeologicTimeScale.meta:comment: In this document, except for the link to the definition of the C14 scale and the to the IUGS International Stratigraphic Chart, all references use the "shorthand pointer" form of URI (http://www.w3.org/TR/xptr-framework/#shorthand), which cross-reference nodes in the current document. This is for convenience only, to allow us to record all the information relating to this time system in one document. Other examples may use references to external resources instead or as well. Either method may be used according to taste or convenience.
In this document the "member" and "group" properties are implemented as pointers to TimeOrdinalEra's described elsewhere within the same document.
